resources.string: A delicious, customizable burrito packed with fluffy rice, savory beans, tender protein, and fresh toppings. Perfect for lunch or dinner, it’s easy to make, satisfying, and bursting with flavors in every bite. Wrap it up and enjoy a handheld meal that’s both hearty and comforting.

string-array.name: burrito_steps
string-array.item: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Warm tortillas for 20–30 seconds on each side.
Lay the tortilla flat and layer rice, beans, and protein in the center.
Add salsa, sour cream, and lettuce.
Fold the sides of the tortilla inwards, then roll it tightly from the bottom.
Serve warm, optionally cut in half.

resources.string: Chicken katsu curry is a popular Japanese comfort dish consisting of a crispy, panko-breaded chicken cutlet served with a sweet, mild, and aromatic Japanese curry sauce, typically over a bed of white rice. The chicken is deeply fried until golden brown, contrasting with the smooth, luxurious texture of the warm, fruity curry.

string-array.name: chicken_katsu_curry_steps
string-array.item: Pound chicken breasts until even thickness.
Coat each piece in flour → dip in beaten egg → coat in panko breadcrumbs.
Fry in hot oil (about 170–180 °C / 340–355 °F) until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towel. Sauté chopped onion, carrot, garlic, and ginger in a little oil until soft.
Stir in curry powder and flour, cook 1 min.
Gradually add chicken stock, stirring until smooth.
Add soy sauce, honey, and ketchup. Simmer 10–15 mins until thickened.

resources.string: Waakye is a Ghanaian dish of rice and beans, cooked with sorghum leaves (waakye leaves) that give it a brown color and earthy flavor. It’s usually served with sides like stew, shito (spicy sauce), fried plantain, spaghetti, gari, boiled eggs, and meat or fish — making it a hearty, complete meal.

string-array.name: waakye_ingredients
string-array.item: Rice (white rice like jasmine or basmati)
Stew (tomato-based, with meat, fish, or shito)

string-array.name: waakye_steps
string-array.item: Soak and cook beans with waakye leaves (or a pinch of baking soda) until tender.
Add rice to the beans, season with salt, and cook until rice is soft and water is absorbed.
Remove leaves, fluff, and serve with sides like stew, shito, plantain, boiled eggs, or meat/fish

resources.string: Lasagne is a classic Italian baked pasta dish made of layers of wide flat pasta sheets, rich meat or vegetable sauce, creamy béchamel or ricotta cheese, and melted cheese on top. It’s hearty, flavorful, and perfect for family meals or special occasions.

string-array.name: lasagne_ingredients
string-array.item: 500g ground beef (or a mix of beef and pork)

string-array.name: lasagne_steps
string-array.item: Cook onions and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add ground meat, cook until browned, then stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, herbs, salt, and pepper; simmer 15–20 minutes.
Make béchamel: melt butter, whisk in flour, gradually add milk, season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Layer meat sauce, lasagne sheets, béchamel, and mozzarella in a baking dish; repeat and top with béchamel, mozzarella, and Parmesan.
Layer meat sauce, lasagne sheets, béchamel, and mozzarella in a baking dish; repeat and top with béchamel, mozzarella, and Parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake 25 minutes, remove foil and bake 15 more minutes until golden.

resources.string: Lamb biryani is a fragrant and flavorful South Asian rice dish made by layering tender, spiced lamb with long-grain basmati rice, aromatic herbs, and sometimes saffron or fried onions. It is slow-cooked to allow the flavors to meld, resulting in a rich, savory, and slightly spicy meal that is both hearty and aromatic, often served with raita, salad, or chutney.

string-array.name: lamb_biryani_steps
string-array.item: Mix lamb chunks with yogurt, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Let it sit for 30 minutes.
Boil water with a pinch of salt and whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon). Cook rice until 70% done, then drain.
Heat oil/ghee in a large pan, sauté cumin seeds, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Add onions and cook until golden brown.
Add marinated lamb to the pan, cook until the lamb is browned and partially cooked. Add tomatoes, coriander powder, and garam masala. Simmer until lamb is tender.
In a large pot, layer half the rice, then the lamb mixture, then the remaining rice. Sprinkle fresh coriander and mint leaves on top.
Cover tightly and cook on very low heat for 20–25 minutes to let flavors meld.
